title: The labels encouraging Chileans to buy healthier food
description: Chile's government introduced food labelling five years ago to drive down its high obesity rate.

title: Questions Rangers must answer after Champions League exit at hands of 10-man Malmo
description: Rangers are out of the Champions League and have lost three games in a row for the first time since May 2015. Is it a temporary blip or are there bigger issues for Steven Gerrard's side?

title: CEO Secrets: Foot Locker boss shares his advice
description: Richard Johnson, CEO of Foot Locker, reflects on the lessons of the pandemic for business leaders.

title: The illegal gold mines killing rivers and livelihoods in Ghana
description: Sixty percent of Ghana's water bodies are now polluted, largely due to illegal mining operations.

title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libya’s war.

title: A-level results: 'We've put in the work and we deserve these grades'
description: Students in England, Wales and Northern Ireland are told their A-level and BTec results.

title: Nottinghamshire boxer, 64, ends career with world title win
description: Steve Ward, previously recognised as the world's oldest male boxer, secures his fairy tale ending.

title: Lithuania blames Belarus for migrant crisis
description: Over 4,000 people are reported to have crossed in Lithuania in recent months.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban seizure will challenge West - Gen Sir Nick Carter
description: The chief of the defence staff on difficulties ahead if the Taliban illegitimately seize control.

title: England's top women snooker players return to the table
description: After an 18-month break due to coronavirus, England's top competitors are back on the baize.

title: The Hundred: London Spirit's Deandra Dottin on her Olympic dream
description: West Indies superstar Deandra Dottin speaks to ECB rising reporter Cameron Ponsonby about her Olympic dream, and the battle she faced to not be at Tokyo 2020.

title: London's Tower Bridge reopens after technical failure
description: The iconic London crossing had been closed for almost 12 hours after a "technical failure".

title: China: Canadian citizen loses appeal against death penalty
description: The verdict comes as an extradition battle in Canada for Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou is ongoing.

title: Artificial Intelligence may diagnose dementia in a day
description: The system being tested should spot the disease long before symptoms or obvious brain signs develop.

title: The Papers: 'Climate code red' and 'top A-level grades soar'
description: Tuesday's papers report the UN warning that time is running out to combat harmful climate change.

title: Mexican drug cartel threatens to kill TV reporter
description: Men claiming to represent Mexico's most powerful drug cartel accused the anchor of unfair coverage.

title: Dungannon: Pair charged over death of Ali Maguire
description: Ali Maguire died in hospital on Friday after an ambulance was called to a house in Dungannon.

title: Stephen Lawrence drama 'celebrates common decency'
description: Steve Coogan says it was an honour to play the man who helped convict two men for the teen's murder.

title: How TV's The Windsors is making its unregal stage debut
description: The creator and cast of the royal comedy satire take us behind the scenes of their West End show.

title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

title: Earth Photo 2021 winners announced
description: A project on family education wins the 2021 Earth Photo competition.
